channel.title: Error running certain clients and sources
channel.description:
Title says it all, could this be due to me running the latest JDK? Should I switch back to JDK 6?
Also, I have tried running my clients numerous times, but this is all I get :'( :http://puu.sh/1QaG2 I have thought of changing the path, but then my source would not be able to run, any help is appreciated.
Thanks
Edit: Tried changing enviromental variables, didnt work.
If someone could help via team viewer, that would help :P.

item.source: Error running certain clients and sources

item.title: Error running certain clients and sources
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xxInfamousxx, post:5, topic:478850”]Okok,

so the path my client is trying to follow:C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe
The path my source compiler is following(working):C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe

and my enviromental variables are set at: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_38\bin[/quote]
The client is trying to go to the x86 program files, which is only on 64 bit computers, and things are only stored there if you get a 32 bit download.
So you can remove that bit and you should be good to go. (it’s highlighted in red)

Also, assuming the variables are set right. For compilers you should be able to just set it to “javac” no quotes, instead of a classpath like you have. To run it, say the client, you can set it to “java” no quotes. So it’d be like so:

from this:

C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe

to this:

java

and this:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_25\bin\javac.exe

to this:

javac

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

xxInfamousxx:

I’ve tried fixing the path, but it comes to no avail…

Okay, post the contents of what ever one is messed up.
Then tell me where your jdk/jre are located.
Oh, if you have your environmental variables set up, there’s an easy way to do this.

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“xxInfamousxx, post:1, topic:478850”]Title says it all, could this be due to me running the latest JDK? Should I switch back to JDK 6?

Also, I have tried running my clients numerous times, but this is all I get :’( :http://puu.sh/1QaG2
I have thought of changing the path, but then my source would not be able to run, any help is appreciated.

Thanks

Edit: Tried changing enviromental variables, didnt work.

If someone could help via team viewer, that would help :P.[/quote]
-facepalm-
That error means it can’t find a path to something. Usually to jdk or jre…
